text: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Introduction: Verily, all praise is due to Allah, we praise Him, we seek His help, and we ask for His forgiveness. We seek refuge in Allah from the evils of our own selves and from our bad deeds. Whomever Allah guides, none can mislead him, and whomever He misguides, none can guide him. I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah alone, having no partner, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and Messenger. He sent him with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and as one who invites to Allah by His permission, and as an illuminating lamp. So he conveyed the message and fulfilled the trust. May Allah bless him and grant him abundant peace. As to what follows: Indeed, one of the major calamities in the present era is that a Muslim student of knowledge is compelled to waste much of his time defending himself and refuting the accusations and falsehoods directed at his person, which have been affixed to him by some people who do not fear Allah and are not ashamed before the slaves of Allah, confirming the saying of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed, among what people realized from the words of the first Prophecy is: If you feel no shame,

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: then do as you wish." And related to this is the saying of the poet: If you do not preserve honor and do not fear a Creator ... And do not feel shame before a created being*, then do as you wish. If you approach a man honoring his rights ... And the right is ignored by you, then severance is more spacious. And since it is known that he who has no shame has no cure, and rebuking him is of no use, it would immediately come to mind that the priority is to turn away from him and leave him to his affairs, as the poet said: If a youth is gifted with an impudent face ... He turns about in matters however he wishes. And there is no use for medicine or anything ... To treat him with, for there is no benefit in it. So you have nothing in rebuking the one who has ... No shame in his face except suffering. However, since silence regarding the likes of him exposes many innocent people to slipping because of him and being influenced by his accusations and falsehoods, it was necessary to reply to him and unveil his fabrications, {so that those who perished [through disbelief] would perish upon evidence and those who lived [in faith] would live upon evidence} [Al-Anfal: 42]. And in that, there is another benefit that returns to the slanderer himself, which is: the possibility that he may return to his senses, and the reduction of his burdens of sin, as a result of reducing the number of misled people involved with him, whose burdens he will carry on top of his own private burdens, as Allah the Exalted said: {And they will surely carry their burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent} [Al-Ankabut: 13]. And in the other verse: {That they may bear

text: their burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they mislead without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear} [An-Nahl: 25]. Perhaps in this there is a reminder and persuasion for those who are not pleased by such replies at all, and who wish that such efforts were directed towards purely academic areas devoid of debate and give-and-take. Most of them do not possess the scientific spirit that helps in discerning the truth regarding what people differ over, and then adhering to it and inviting to it. And although we are with those people in what they wish for, they must remember that often the winds blow with what the ship's crew does not desire, as the poet said: Not everything a man wishes for does he attain ... The winds blow with what the ships do not desire. Also, it is not from the attributes of the believers to remain silent over oppression, injustice, slander, and lies affixed to them, while they find a legitimate means to repel it and return it to its owner, contrary to what is attributed to our Master Jesus, peace be upon him, which the Christians call the Golden Verse: "Whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the left cheek, and whoever asks you for your garment, give him your cloak, and whoever asks you to walk with him a mile, walk with him two miles"! There is nothing of this in Islam; rather, in its absolute sense, it contradicts the Holy Quran in clarifying some of the attributes of the believing servants of the Most Merciful, among which is what the noble verse conveyed: {And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves * And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from Allah. Indeed, He does not like

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: the wrongdoers * And whoever avenges himself after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame] * The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment} [Ash-Shura: 39-42]. So if there is nothing in all that has preceded that convinces those people, then at least let it be considered an excuse for me, for it has been said: Haste in blame is not justice. And the poet said: Take your time and do not hasten to blame your companion ... Perhaps he has an excuse while you are blaming. Indeed, it was incumbent upon them to turn upon the unjust oppressor with blame and disapproval and deter him from his injustice, and to support the oppressed, due to his saying, upon him be peace and blessings: "Help your brother, whether he is an oppressor or is oppressed. It was said:* How do I help him if he is an oppressor? He said: You prevent him from oppression, for that is helping him." And in another Hadith: "Let a man help his brother, whether he is an oppressor or is oppressed: if he is an oppressor, let him forbid him, for that is a help to him, and if he is oppressed, let him help him." And his saying: "No man forsakes a Muslim man in a place where his honor is disparaged and his sanctity is violated, except that Allah the Exalted will forsake him in a place where he loves His support. And no one supports a Muslim in a place where his honor is disparaged and his sanctity is violated, except that Allah will support him in a place where he loves His support" (1). In any case, it is known that pleasing people is an unattainable goal, as stated in some proverbs: No stick struck another stick but that a group was saddened by it, and others were pleased

text: by it. And the poet said: And I am not safe from the saying of a slanderer ... Even if I were in a cave on a rugged mountain. And who is the one who escapes from people unharmed ... Even if he was absent from them between the wings of an eagle. And if the matter is so, then it suffices me that I will adhere in this reply of mine to the limits of the Sharia, so I will not meet the aggressor with any aggression, nor the slanderer with any slander. Rather, I will describe him with what is in him so that people may beware of him so they do not go astray by his misguidance, nor deviate by his deviation from the Book of Allah and the Sunnah of His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, especially those among them who have recently come into contact with him and have been deceived by his appearance and have no knowledge of the reality of his affair, as the poet said: Let not a friend ever deceive you ... By appearance, until you test him. How many a friend concerning whom I was blind ... His appearance deceived me for a time. He would meet me with a cheerful face ... And words like pearls he spreads. But when I searched him for his unseen [reality] ... I did not find that to correspond to what he conceals. So leave brothers alone, except every one who ... Conceals affection just as he reveals it. So if you win one who combines this ... Then make him a treasure for yourself to store.

text: And scholars have long said: Criticism is not backbiting in six [cases] ... An oppressed person, an identifier, a warner. And one who openly commits immorality, and one seeking a fatwa, and one who ... Seeks help in removing an evil. And a single trait of these traits is sufficient to permit such a reply, so how about when others are joined to it, especially the first of them? And its proof is the saying of Allah the Blessed and Exalted: {Allah does not like the public mention of evil in words except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing} [An-Nisa: 148]. And his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "The procrastination of the wealthy makes his honor and punishment permissible" (1). And the poet said: And placing dew in the place of the sword is by height ... Harmful, like placing the sword in the place of dew. I ask Allah the Blessed and Exalted to protect us from injustice and belittling people without right, and to make what I write a defense of the Sunnah of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and the path of the Salaf as-Salih (Pious Predecessors). Indeed, He is Hearing and Responsive. Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani

text: Preface I became acquainted with Sheikh Abd al-Fattah "Abu Ghuddah" in his hometown (Aleppo) approximately more than twenty years ago. I recognized in him a man who was blindly fanatical towards the Hanafi school of thought. In a lesson of his in his mosque in Aleppo, he decided on the permissibility of medical treatment with alcohol upon the guidance of a skilled Muslim doctor. So I said to him: This is not enough; rather, he must be knowledgeable in the Sunnah. For in the Sunnah, for example, alcohol is described as a disease and not a cure. So how is it conceivable for a learned Muslim doctor, knowledgeable of his Sharia, to prescribe a medicine that his Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, described as a disease?! He said: Perhaps the Hadith is weak and not authentic! I said: How so, when it is in "Sahih Muslim" (1). He said: We will check to make sure of that. One of those present, who was a friend to both parties, said to him: So if you make sure of its authenticity, will you take it or the Madhhab (School of Thought)? He said: The Madhhab! And I confirmed later his extreme fanaticism from what reached me of his campaigns in his sermons and lessons against Salafism and its callers. Because of that, some of our brothers in Aleppo strove earnestly to hold meetings between him and me to discuss his fanaticism against the Sunnah and to explain the Call (Da'wah) to him. But he would not respond to any meeting he was invited to, even if individually.

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: Unless it was for a meal! But he would not make room for any research regarding the Salafi Call; rather, he would eat and then leave! Yet, he continued with innuendos, hints, and defamation, just like other ignorant, hateful preachers. Then days and years passed, and suddenly Abu Ghuddah was appointed as a teacher in the College of Sharia in Riyadh. In the summer vacation, he used to spend it in Lebanon and frequently visit the house and library of our brother, Mr. Zuhair al-Shawish, his friend at that time. I used to meet him there sometimes, and he persisted in his previous stance of refraining from entering into any discussion or research, despite the mediation of Mr. Zuhair and his pushing him to accept the research, but in vain. It was from the policy of Brother Zuhair and his wisdom at that time with him that he would sometimes present him to lead us in prayer, to show him practically that the rumors he and his likes spread about [our] Takfir (declaring others non-Muslims) were false, evidenced by my praying behind him, even though his prayer contradicted the authentic Sunnah in many of its rulings! He seemed delighted by this presentation, stepping forward without any hesitation, apology, or deferring to anyone else! As if he did not want, in return, to prove to us that he considers his prayer valid behind the one praying behind him!! And while outward appearances indicated that Abu Ghuddah in recent times was a peaceful man to the extent that he fled from entering into a calm scientific discussion, let alone a heated sectarian dispute, content with his fanaticism for "The Imam of Imams, and the Foremost of the Ummah, Abu Hanifa, may Allah be pleased with him..." Suddenly, he reveals that "beneath the sheep's skin is the heart of a wolf" and that "nature overcame nurture"! For he returned to launching a campaign

text: of severe agitation and vilification against me in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the location of his job, and Lebanon, the country of his summer vacation. That is: 1 - What he broadcasted of falsehood and spread of slander here and there until it reached the hearing of some Muslim students in Europe that Al-Albani attacks the four schools of thought, especially the Hanafi school, in his commentary on the book "Mukhtasar Sahih Muslim by Al-Hafiz Al-Mundhiri", while it contains nothing but my saying: "Indeed Jesus, peace be upon him, will rule by our Sharia..." which will be explained later along with the reply to it. For Abu Ghuddah was not content with spreading that with his tongue, until he wrote it with his pen (1), so he is thereby like one wearing two garments of falsehood: and the printing of the Mukhtasar was in the year 1388. 2 - His fabrication against me, implicitly and explicitly, that I am among the haters and those who detest Imam Abu Hanifa, may Allah have mercy on him. He accused me of fanaticism against him, may Allah have mercy on him, and of scientific treachery in his biography, and that was in his commentary on the book "Qawa'id fi 'Ulum al-Hadith" (Rules in the Sciences of Hadith) by Sheikh Al-Thanvi. He finished commenting on it - as he stated in its conclusion - in Rabi' al-Thani in the year 1390 in Riyadh, meaning before he filed his unjust report, or at least one year before my reply to him in the "Introduction to the Explanation of At-Tahawiyyah" (2).

text: And the virtuous brother, Mr. Zuhair al-Shawish, replied to him in a treatise: "Al-Tawdih" (The Clarification), the best of replies, by revealing his fabrication and the mentioned accusation by quoting from my books what testifies for Abu Hanifa, may Allah have mercy on him, regarding the knowledge and virtue he deserves. He thereby demonstrated that "Abu Ghuddah" is the one who betrayed the scientific trust when he quoted my words in a mutilated form. So let whoever wishes for the explanation check his mentioned treatise, which is printed separately and with "Sharh al-Aqidah al-Tahawiyyah" (Explanation of the Tahawiyyah Creed), Fourth Edition.

And when some of those by whose command Abu Ghuddah moves saw Abu Ghuddah's words, they made him understand that this declaration of accusing Al-Albani exposes you to legal prosecution in the penal courts, and you will be convicted of the crime of slander!! So Abu Ghuddah became afraid and proceeded to remove pages (305), (306), (307), and (308) and what corresponds to them, which are pages (317), (318), (319), and (320), and reprinted them after deleting my name, and put in its place (some haters..) overlooking the footnote that remained printed, which is "(1) In 'Silsilat Al-Ahadith Al-Da'ifah wal-Mawdu'ah' 5: 76". And anyone who owns a copy of the book "Al-Qawa'id" can verify that if he compares the paper of these pages with the rest of the book's paper, and also if he looks at the many holes in the sewing of the book due to undoing the previous sewing and re-sewing, gathering, and binding it anew!! And what confirms this is Abu Ghuddah's complete silence about raising it in his "Words", for if he were able to collect all the previous copies, he would not have delayed accusing the author of "Al-Tawdih" with various accusations as is Abu Ghuddah's habit!!

text: 3 - His unjust report that he submitted to some officials in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in the year 1391 or slightly before that - and to non-officials as well - regarding my extraction (Takhrij) of "Sharh al-Aqidah al-Tahawiyyah". That was after he had seen it about ten years prior, without ever speaking to me at all about anything he had in mind of criticism regarding it, while we were meeting with him during these years at the place of our brother Mr. Zuhair al-Shawish, or at least speaking to him about it!! And he [Zuhair] is the owner of the Islamic Office and the publisher of the book (1). All these matters and others that reached me about him made me certain that we have been tested with a cunning enemy, who shows the opposite of what he conceals, and that a reply to him must be written, revealing his ignorance in what he criticized me for in his "Unjust Report" and what he included of lies, falsehood, inversion of facts, and other traits that do not befit a believer who believes in Allah and the Last Day. So I wrote the reply and made it an introduction to the fourth edition of Sharh al-Aqidah al-Tahawiyyah, so that the noble readers would be aware of the reply to Abu Ghuddah's objections closely, and know his severe hostility to this Creed, hiding behind criticizing the one who extracted its Hadiths, and pretending to honor its explainer! After the issuance of this edition in late 1391 AH, I performed Hajj to the House of Allah, so I visited the virtuous professor Dr. Muhammad Amin al-Masri in his house in Makkah Al-Mukarramah. He told me that Sheikh Abu Ghuddah was with him in another room with some professors from Aleppo. So I said to him: Would you be so kind as to present to him my desire to meet him and discuss with him regarding what came in his "Report"? He agreed

text: happily, but he soon returned sorry because Abu Ghuddah refused the meeting despite the professors' approval of this offer of mine, as Dr. Al-Masri told me, and he is among the most trustworthy people to me. Starting the reply to the words of "Abu Ghuddah" and his falsehoods. And after about three years from printing the reply to the unjust report, Sheikh Abu Ghuddah came out to us with his treatise: "Words in Unveiling Falsehoods and Fabrications", mentioning at its end that he finished it on 12/4/1394 in the city of Riyadh. After finishing reading it, it became clear to me that it is a reply to a group of those who replied to him and revealed to people his ignorance of the Sunnah and his severe hostility to its people and its Imams, foremost among them Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah, and his student the scholar Ibn Qayyim al-Jawziyyah, and the caller to Tawhid Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul Wahhab, may Allah the Exalted have mercy on them, whom Abu Ghuddah opposes with the utmost hostility following his Sheikh Al-Kawthari, the deviant misguider, and of whom he is a relic!! And that there is absolutely no knowledge in it; rather, it is truly lies and falsehoods. Among that is his giving the impression to the readers that there is a group of authors working against him, cooperating and conspiring "from the owners of bad purposes and deviant plotting intentions..." according to his claim. This is a pure lie, and to clarify that I say: The books or treatises that Abu Ghuddah replies to some of what came in them and gives the illusion to the readers that the group cooperated to author and publish them are: 1 - The book "Sufism between Truth and Creation" by Mr. Muhammad Fahr al-Shaqfa, second edition, increased and verified. It is known that the one who undertook its publication and commenting on it is Mr. Mahmoud Istanbuli.

text: 2 - "The Polished* Ingenious Sword against the Falsehoods of Al-Kawthari's Student" which is by Mr. Abdul Aziz al-Rabian, a teacher at the Secondary Institute at the Islamic University in Madinah Munawwarah, who was at the College of Sharia in Riyadh the day Abu Ghuddah was a teacher there and invited him to debate with him but he refused. 3 - An article published in Al-Da'wah newspaper issue 323. 4 - My introduction to "Sharh al-Aqidah al-Tahawiyyah". 5 - "The Comparison between Guidance and Misguidance" by the pen of Sheikh Abdul Razzaq Hamza, may Allah have mercy on him, and investigation by Abdullah bin Saleh al-Madani the jurist. 6 - "Al-Tawdih" (The Clarification) for the mentioned introduction by Mr. Zuhair al-Shawish, and Abu Ghuddah did not disclose its name, perhaps because the author is Abu Ghuddah's old friend! 7 - "The Hajj of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him" authored by me. 8 - My commentary on "Mukhtasar Muslim" by Al-Mundhiri. 9 - " The Veil of the Muslim Woman" authored by me. 10 - "The Innovation of Sectarian Fanaticism" by brother Mr. Muhammad Eid Abbasi. So you see Abu Ghuddah, if he replies to a sentence in one of these books, he attributes it to all these authors, even the one written by Sheikh Abdul Razzaq, may Allah have mercy on him, giving the illusion that they wrote that conspiring and cooperating! Even though I absolutely did not participate in authoring any of them, not even in "Al-Tawdih", so how about in the book of Sheikh Abdul Razzaq, may Allah have mercy on him?!

text: Consequently, no one among them participated with me in authoring any of my mentioned works, and Abu Ghuddah is aware of that. Yet, he attributes every phrase he replies to to all of them. He says in the first book, p. (5): "They printed it in Damascus in the year 1390 and inserted into it falsely and slanderously words about me..." The truth is that the one who printed it is Mr. Mahmoud Istanbuli, and the alleged insertion, if proven, has absolutely nothing to do with us, especially since my style of writing differs from his style as is known to everyone...

It stated: "And this matter was an addition by the publisher Mahmoud Mahdi Istanbuli without knowledge from me... for I saw good in him when he offered to bring out my book... so the publisher exploited this authorization... and I have warned the publisher." And similar to that is in Mr. Fahr's other letter whose image is published following the first letter. From that, it becomes clear that Abu Ghuddah did not only lie against the group by attributing the alleged insertion to all of them, not to the publisher alone as is explicit in Mr. Fahr's words. But he also lied against the Professor himself in his previous saying: "As soon as* its author learned

text: of that insertion, his anger raged against them..." And I do not think but that Mr. Fahr's anger actually raged against Abu Ghuddah for this false attribution to him! Abu Ghuddah was not content with the preceding lies but confirmed it by saying (p. 6): "And they yielded to the author's request, and placed on the mentioned book.." And Allah bears witness that we have no knowledge of the mentioned placement nor of the fabricated yielding except when we read this phrase of Abu Ghuddah, so do we not have the right to say: Is not... And likewise he said regarding what came in the rest of the previously mentioned books: "they transferred" and "they said" and similar to that which is contrary to reality, and examples of it will be mentioned. For the transferrer and the sayer is the author, so what is the matter with the others, among whom is one who has moved to the mercy of Allah, and this one has no knowledge of what occurred after him of dispute between the people of Sunnah like him and the people of desires and innovations like the student of Al-Kawthari, and the others have no knowledge of what he, may Allah have mercy on him, authored, naturally after the spread of his book as well! How great is Abu Ghuddah's negligence, or rather how great is his lying! Because of all that, I decided to restrict my reply to "Abu Ghuddah" to what affected me of his oppression, injustice, and fabrication, leaving it to others to reply to him if they wish, so that this reply does not become too long, for the people of the house know best what is in it, and Allah the Mighty and Majestic says: {Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses * And of Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] * That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another * And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives} [An-Najm: 36-39]. So I say, and with Allah alone I seek help: First - Among Abu Ghuddah's oddities is that when he addressed replying to me regarding what I said about him rightfully in the introduction to Sharh al-Tahawiyyah "in reply to

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: his unjust report", he did nothing more than count the words I described him with in it - rightfully - saying (p. 10): "For they stuffed it with the following words: 'with fanaticism, intentional lying, and... and ignorance and... and imitation... and hypocrisy... and that I am a Hanafi... and dispraising the Hanafi Sheikhs and that they are at a high degree of fanaticism and that they harbor severe hostility towards the people of Hadith...'" I say: The aspect of oddity is that he recounted these words which I described him with without replying to them with proof and evidence, contenting himself with saying that they are "explicit fabrication." Knowing that these words came within the folds of my reply to him, which amounts to "44" pages. So these words that he listed do not amount to a single page of it, so where is the reply to the rest of the pages in which I convicted him of all that? Does any rational, fair person doubt, when seeing Abu Ghuddah not writing a single word in reply to them to prove his innocence from them - that if he found a way to do so, he would not have sufficed with what we pointed out of his sayings? And there is no harm in repeating the summary of what he had held against me and hinted at in his unjust report, and my reply to him and what I convicted him of in the Introduction. Summary of what Abu Ghuddah held against me, my reply to him, and what I convicted him of in the "Introduction". 1 - He had accused me that my saying in the extraction (Takhrij) "Authentic (Sahih), excluded by Muslim" or "Authentic, agreed upon" meant the authenticity came from my judgment of it as authentic and not from the judgment of Imam Muslim or the Two Sheikhs, and that what I said about it "Narrated by Muslim" or "Agreed upon" without prefacing it with my saying "Authentic" meant to him that I was hesitant about it and it was under review! And he said: So he came with something that the predecessors and successors did not precede him in. So I said to him:

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: This is conjecture and fabrication... and I detailed the statement on that in four pages of the Introduction "17 - 20" and clarified that I had stated in the introduction to the third edition my goal from this terminology, and that I was preceded in this usage by Al-Hafiz Al-Baghawi in "Sharh al-Sunnah". So I proved thereby his conjecture and ignorance. So how did he answer it? Instead of admitting his ignorance and his accusation of his Muslim brother with what is not in him - while he is aware of it - he persisted in that and did not retract. Rather, he resorted to arrogance and feigning humility in his reply that he is innocent and oppressed before the readers, most of whom do not know what his hands committed. Is this the attribute of one who says in the beginning of his treatise: "And after, indeed Allah the Exalted legislated for us this Hanif religion to be a barrier for the believer in it from every evil and badness, and a caller to perform every good and virtue, and for the one affiliated with it to realize the upright character and straight behavior so he says nothing but the truth..." etc of his words, the end of which reminds one of the proverb "She accused me of her illness and slunk away" because he accuses us in it of lies and fabrications while he is their source and fountainhead, and this is the first example before you. So is this persistence in accusation and feigning ignorance from the upright character according to Abu Ghuddah while he knows His saying, the Exalted: {O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do? * Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do} [As-Saf: 2-3]. 2 - He also criticized me for my saying regarding the report of Ibn Mas'ud: "He perished who does not have a heart with which he knows the known (good) and the unknown (evil)": "I do not know it (La a'rifuhu)". So he said following it exactly: "So is the meaning of this that he does not know the known from the unknown (!) or he does not know the speech of Abdullah bin Mas'ud".

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: So I replied to him in five pages (21 - 26) and clarified the terminology of scholars in this phrase "I do not know it" from what Abu Ghuddah himself quoted in an introduction of his to some of his publications. So I attributed him because of that to feigning ignorance, and to ignorance as well, and that his mentioned saying has no relation to this terminology which I followed the Muhaddithin (Hadith scholars) in using. And that he only said that to quench the anger of his heart, and show people the ambush of his hatred, and the greatness of his envy through his foul language such that he does not know what comes out of his mouth; we ask Allah for well-being. So Abu Ghuddah did not reply to this either with anything absolute except his claim that I accused him (and he says deceptively to the readers 'they accused me'!) of ignorance and feigning ignorance! If you were, O Abu Ghuddah, truthful in this saying, why didn't you explain the relationship of your saying "So is the meaning of this that he does not know the known from the unknown" to my saying: "I do not know it" and prove thereby that you are not ignorant nor feigning ignorance, while you are the one saying in your words "and my behavior is exposed and my character is known, and praise be to Allah"?! Yes, your behavior is exposed and your character is known, and praise be to Allah who is not praised for a hateful thing other than Him. 3 - and 4 - He had recorded against me two delusions; he declared one of them, and he was correct in that, but he deceived in the course of explaining it a malicious deception with his inversion of some facts as I clarified (p. 29 - 30). So the deception and inversion of facts that I convicted him of stuck to him, because he did not bring even a single word showing his innocence from it, except his saying regarding it and its likes: explicit fabrication!! The other delusion he pointed to, and did not declare, was that I had attributed a delusion to the Explainer (Al-Tahawi), may Allah have mercy on him, in his attributing a Hadith to the "Sahih" while it is not in it. So Abu Ghuddah recounted my words on that and added nothing, his purpose in that being to give the illusion to the readers that I am deluded in my attribution of delusion

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: to the Explainer. The reality is that there is no delusion, and he intended behind the mentioned recording to drop the confidence of the readers among the people of knowledge and virtue in Al-Albani's extraction (Takhrij)! To take that as a pretext to turn people away from the book itself "Sharh al-Aqidah". So I replied to him in several pages, the summary of which is: That it does not necessitate from the error of a trustworthy person in one Hadith or more that trust be removed from him absolutely. And I supported that with what the unjust fanatic himself quoted in some of his commentaries. And I compelled him to drop trust in the Explainer of the Tahawiyyah due to real errors, not few, which I clarified in my extraction on it then summarized in the "Introduction". So I compelled him thereby to one of two things: First, that Al-Albani's error in a Hadith or more does not drop trust in him. And the other: that if that does drop trust in him, then the Explainer's errors are more, so he is more deserving and apparent for dropping trust in him according to Abu Ghuddah. So he remained silent about that as well, so what I compelled him with stuck to him as is apparent, especially since I had requested him to explain to me if I was mistaken in that according to him, but he did not do so. So who says after this that he "does not play on two ropes"?! 5 - He had hinted at me regarding my saying about a Hadith narrated by Al-Bukhari: "And in its chain is weakness, but it has paths by which perhaps it is strengthened..." So I replied to him from two aspects: The summary of the first of them is that I am preceded in weakening its chain by senior Imams like Al-Dhahabi, Ibn Rajab Al-Hanbali, and Al-Hafiz Al-Asqalani, and that I was reserved in weakening its text; rather, I hoped it would be strengthened by the multitude of its paths. Then I confirmed that as I clarified in "Al-Sahihah" (1640). The summary of the other aspect is that I compelled him that hinting at and attacking his Sheikh Al-Kawthari is more appropriate because he quoted the attack on the mentioned Hadith of Al-Bukhari

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: just mentioned and approved it, without holding the reservation I mentioned! Then I followed it by mentioning fourteen authentic Hadiths from what Al-Bukhari and Muslim or one of them extracted, all of which his Sheikh Al-Kawthari "The Investigator Mark, the Proof, the Imam.." as his student Abu Ghuddah claims, weakened, and another Hadith from what Muslim narrated which the unjust fanatic himself weakened! (See p. 30 - 34 of the Introduction). And by his silence on the saying of Sheikh Al-Thanvi in his book "Introduction to I'la al-Sunan" under the title "Mention of some defects in the Two Sahihs and the affectation of answering them": "And what people say that whoever the Two Sheikhs narrated for has crossed the bridge, this is from affectation and is not strong." Abu Ghuddah remained silent on this in his commentary on the book (463). And on the preceding examples of what he himself wrote or read by his Sheikh, yet he attacks me for a single Hadith of Al-Bukhari whose chain I weakened without its text, then he ignores all that to say complaining in his "Words" that we accused him of "...and playing on two ropes" and he missed mentioning that we said about such an action of his that it is from the chapter of weighing with two scales, and measuring with two measures, or from the type of combining summer and winter on one roof! So who denies the applicability of all these descriptions to Abu Ghuddah after seeing these facts. If the unjust fanatic was truthful in that complaint of his, he would have answered a scientific answer to all these compulsions we compelled him with. And he would not have sufficed with replying to all that by saying: "Explicit fabrication" and similar sayings which the most ignorant of people and those most immersed in falsehood and obstinacy are not incapable of, as per their saying: A goat even if it flew. Second - Is this not exposed hypocrisy? I mentioned in the Introduction that I have decisive proof for what I attributed to Abu Ghuddah of equivocation (Mudarah) and I did not say sycophancy (Mudahanah).

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: And so I spoke back then with reservation and deliberation until we see Abu Ghuddah's answer to what I claimed was decisive proof. Then I quoted from him his saying in his unjust report on the Explainer of the Tahawiyyah: "It is from trusting and... in a tangible famous leadership (Imamah)". And because of my knowledge that Abu Ghuddah is a fanatical Hanafi, and Hanafis are Maturidis, and the Explainer refutes them in many places, especially in the Attribute of Divine Speech, it appeared to me that Abu Ghuddah says about him what he does not believe for a purpose I explained there. Therefore, I followed his mentioned saying with my saying: "I said: If Abu Ghuddah truly believes in this tangible famous leadership, then I choose for him from the speech of this Imam seven issues. If he answers them with what agrees with what this famous Imam went to with a sincere heart, then that is what we hope for, and I apologize to him for thinking ill of him. But if it is the other, then that supports - unfortunately - what I accused him of regarding equivocation." Then I listed the seven issues with some commentary on them and clarification of his Sheikh Al-Kawthari's stance against them, which are: First: And the people of blameworthy theological rhetoric (Kalam) apply the negation of the occurrence of incidents [in Allah's essence]. Second: And that the Quran is the Speech of Allah, from Him it appeared without modality as speech, and He sent it down upon His Messenger as revelation, and the believers believed Him on that truly, and they became certain that the Speech of Allah the Exalted is in reality not created like the speech of creation. (1) Third: And He, the Exalted, is independent of the Throne and what is below it, encompassing everything and is above it.

text: Fourth: The Imam affirms asking about 'Aboveness' with the phrase 'Where is Allah' which the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, asked the slave girl to know her faith. And I said to him there: And your Sheikh, O Abu Ghuddah, denies such a question following his casting doubt on the authenticity of the Hadith as preceded (p. 22). So do you believe in this Hadith and permit this question which the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, asked? Fifth: The Imam says following the three Imams and others: Faith is affirmation with the heart, and acknowledgment with the tongue, and action with the pillars (limbs), and they said: It increases and decreases. Sixth: The Imam went to the permissibility of exception in Faith, which is the believer saying: 'I am a believer, Insha'Allah (if Allah wills)' contrary to the Hanafis. Rather, a group of them went to declaring the one who says that a disbeliever. Seventh: The Imam went, following his Imam Abu Hanifa and his two companions, to the dislike (Karahah) of Tawassul (seeking means) by the right of the Prophets and their status. Then I said following it: "I said: So these are seven important issues, all in Creed except the last of them, which I directed to Abu Ghuddah who pretended to praise the Explainer of the Tahawiyyah and described him as having 'tangible famous leadership'. So if he answers by following him in them - and this is what I consider unlikely given his Kawtharism - then praise be to Allah. But if he opposes him in them and remains on his Kawtharism, then it has become clear to people - if Allah the Exalted wills - that his praise of the Explainer of the Tahawiyyah (the Imam) was not out of belief and trust in him as he claimed, but rather to use it as a ladder to attack the one who extracted its Hadiths. Otherwise, how was it permissible for him to remain silent about the Explainer regarding these errors, rather deviations,

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: the seven [deviations] according to his claim following Al-Kawthari, and regarding his other Hadith errors which I previously indicated types of, and criticize me complaining to some of his bosses or officials there and others - in matters - which if his criticism in them were correct - are hardly worth mentioning compared to those in quantity or quality?!" So what was the answer of the unjust fanatic to these seven questions?! The noble reader will be amazed if I said: He turned away from answering them absolutely, and fell silent towards them like the silence of the People of the Cave. He neither declared that he follows the owner of the "tangible famous leadership" in them, nor that he is still on his Kawtharism in them. So who says after this that this is not exposed hypocrisy or that he is still a Kawthari as some of his colleagues in studying under Al-Kawthari described him in what I quoted from him (p. 46 of the Introduction). And he admitted that and did not deny it in his "Words"; rather, he confirmed it by saying in it (p. 38): "They know from about 25 years that I am a student of Al-Kawthari, so what is the meaning that I became his student now." I say: This is a lie from his lies that have no end. For who among those I referred to and described as having knowledge said that you became his student now? The truth is that you were exposed to people who did not know you before your commentaries which you blackened with quotes from your Sheikh Al-Kawthari and your exaggeration in praising him despite his severe hostility to Hadith and its people. And you pushed us by force by that - and by your vilification of us in your frantic campaigns for the slightest slip you imagine, especially in your unjust report where you put down a person and elevate another - despite their sharing in the error - to reply to you and unveil your identity and explain what you are upon of attributes which you summarized in your (Words) (p. 10) and I was reserved regarding

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: some of them due to what the Sharia obligates upon us of verification and confirmation. As for now, the truth has become manifest to everyone with two eyes. And indeed, what confirms his remaining on his Kawtharism, and his preference for imitating him over imitating his Imam Abu Hanifa and his two companions, may Allah have mercy on them, in many issues, is that Al-Kawthari has a treatise titled "Mahq* al-Taqawwul fi Mas'alat al-Tawassul" (The Eradication of Fabrication in the Issue of Tawassul) in which he went to its permissibility and took the path of absolute Ijtihad in it. He used as evidence Hadiths, some authentic which do not indicate it, and some weak which he tried to strengthen by strengthening weak narrators following his desire, contradicting thereby his own declaration of his weakness in another Hadith as I explained some of that in the beginning of my book "Silsilat Al-Ahadith Al-Da'ifah". And out of his following his desire and following the common people, he did not address in it the mention of the sayings of his three Imams because they eradicate his treatise from its foundation (1). So you find Abu Ghuddah imitating him in this issue, despite his contradicting his three Imams in a sermon he delivered in his mosque in Aleppo, and naturally that was before his employment in Saudi Arabia. I have obtained a recorded tape of his sermon, in which is the declaration of some of his ideas and beliefs in which he contradicts the belief of the Salaf as-Salih and those who followed them in goodness like Sheikh al-Islam Ibn Taymiyyah and Muhammad bin Abdul Wahhab and others. Such as his belief that Shirk (polytheism) is only Shirk of Rububiyyah (Lordship), so he permits Tawassul by the Prophet and the Wali (Saint) to Allah without calling upon him and asking from him. And if he asks by mistake, then this caller does not believe regarding him that he looses and binds, gives and withholds, lowers and raises, and disposes in the destinies of Allah the Mighty and Majestic!! Therefore, seeking aid (Istighatha) from the dead other than Allah the Exalted is not Shirk according to him because the seeker of aid does not believe that

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: the dead harms and benefits, but rather it is only a verbal mistake! Yet, Sheikh Abu Ghuddah is not ashamed to declare in his words (p. 36) that he worships Allah the Exalted with the creed of the Salaf, may Allah be pleased with them, and that he holds the division of Tawhid into Tawhid al-Uluhiyyah and Tawhid al-Rububiyyah! And he missed the third division, which is Tawhid of Attributes, and perhaps he left it intentionally. Because the Khalaf (Successors/Later generations), and he is among them, do not know this type of Tawhid, and if they knew it, they would not have negated many of His Attributes, the Exalted, in the name of interpretation (Ta'wil) like their negation of His Uloo (Highness) over His creation. A sermon by Abu Ghuddah attacking the Salafis. And it is necessary on this occasion that I present some of Sheikh Abu Ghuddah's sermon transcribed from a recorded tape preserved with me, and whoever doubts it, I will make him hear it with his voice and his heat in it, so that the extent of his hostility to the people of Tawhid and the callers to the Sunnah, his malice against them, his hatred for them, and his accusing them of various accusations in the manner of his Sheikh Al-Kawthari in that, or rather worse than him, becomes clear to the reader. He is in that unique in his kind! His accusing the Salafis of ignorantizing the Imams and belittling the status of scholars and Ijtihad. He said after a brief introduction on the virtue of the Mujtahid Imams and their adherence to the Sunnah: "We say this to clarify what comes from some people, of attributing ignorance to the Imams, belittling the status of scholars, and deeming some of their opinions foolish, thinking that they are on correctness, and that if they have smelled the scent of knowledge, then they are on certainty regarding what they know, and that it is in their power to fault the scholars and attribute ignorance to the Imams, and belittle the status of Ijtihad, and make it light to the people, even to the simplest of people,

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: even if he was a professional who did not know his craft, or rather, did not master it! He could say: 'This is Halal and this is Haram' solely by his opinion or merely because he memorized a Hadith or two. This is a clear error and deviation from the path. For Ijtihad (independent legal reasoning) in this Ummah is not achieved by its stalwarts nor its intelligent ones unless they acquire the tools of Ijtihad. These tools are the introduction to acquiring Ijtihad (here there is an erasure from the tape of about a line) from the Holy Quran and the Noble Hadith, and among them is the knowledge of the competitions (sic) of the Arabs and their styles, and among them also is understanding the speech of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, according to the rules of the upright Islam, as the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, understood it. As for the one who has a bit of knowledge and thinks he can climb the peak of Ijtihad, this is a sleeping human, who saw himself [in a dream] that he is sleeping too (!), and walked striving in his sleep which he saw in his slumber (!). So he is upon weakness and error without knowing his worth. Because Ijtihad requires extreme confidence of understanding, complete knowledge of science, the traces of the jurists and their sayings, the Ijtihad of the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and their actions, and the sayings of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and the Speech of Allah the Mighty and Majestic, and other means of knowledge that scholars have established in their place. Returning to his accusation of them belittling the status of scholars, casting their Ijtihads to the ground, and of arrogance and ignorance. Therefore, he errs who faults the scholars or belittles their status. Or claims that he can dominate over these Imams and cast their Ijtihads one by one to the ground. The origin of this is arrogance and deficiency in knowledge, and ignorance of the value of scholars as well. And that is that those people were ignorant of many things, so they fell into many errors.

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: His accusing them of belittling the status of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and denying his miracles!! Among these errors is that they belittle (sic) the status of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, making him (sic) one of the people after his death and during his life, not distinguished from any human being. And he is so, except in what Allah the Mighty and Majestic honored him with. And Allah the Mighty and Majestic has honored His Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, with miracles (Karamat), and what miracles! For the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, is alive after his death by which he moved from the world to his grave, for the Prophets are alive in their graves. So the one who claims that the Prophets are dead like the state of dead people: this is a human who does not differentiate between the living and the dead, nor the Prophet and the false prophet. So it is his right [duty] to re-study from A to Z, because the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, indicated to us that the martyrs are alive in their graves (!) and our Master the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, is above the martyrs in rank, honor, station, and veneration. Therefore, belittling the status of the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, under the pretext of purifying the doctrine is an error and a deviation. We witness from those people that they do not mention the miracles (Karamat) of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, nor his noble miracles (Mu'jizat), nor his lofty states, to an extent that chests would expand with (!). Rather, they revolve around things from which they feel, or a person feels in them, that it belittles the status of Prophecy and shrinks the shadow of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and makes him like a human among humans, no less and no more (!). This invites them to get involved in many errors. Therefore, these people err in these allegations which I alluded to, multiple errors. For this reason, a person should not be deceived by these sayings or by such claims that they claim: For our Master the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, commanded us

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: to follow the scholars who have acceptance, knowledge, and complete aptitude. Which qualifies them to be Imams in the religion. And if we look into the biography of Imam Abu Hanifa, or Imam Al-Shafi'i, or Imam Malik, or Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal, may Allah be pleased with them, we find in the biography of each of them a new leadership (Imamah) (!). Meaning, if we looked at his behavior in his house, we found him an Imam. If we looked at his behavior with people, we found him an Imam. If we looked at his worship, we found him an Imam. If we looked at his preservation of knowledge, we found him an Imam. If we looked at his understanding of texts, we found him an Imam. If we looked at his devotion (!) and piety and his exiting from his self (!), we found him an Imam. So every character trait of those Imams is a lamp from the lamps of guidance and rationality. This is the measure of knowledge and the measure of being guided by people. Returning to his accusing the Salafis of reckless disregard for the Mujtahids and belittling their status, and forbidding people from following them while calling them to follow themselves. Therefore, reckless disregard for the Mujtahids and belittling their status, and the claim (sic) of people to perform Ijtihad, or those people prohibiting (!) the following of the Mujtahid Imams contains a great error. Because they forbid people to follow Abu Hanifa, Al-Shafi'i, Ahmad, and Malik, may Allah be pleased with them, and invite them to follow themselves (!). So they forbid them to imitate the Imams, and invite them to imitate themselves (!). As if they forbid this for others, and permit it for themselves. And if we are imitators (Muqallideen), and your speaker is among the imitators, and he who is higher than him in knowledge is among the imitators (sic), if we are so, then do we imitate

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: those whom people testified for, and people tested their knowledge, and people served their Madhhab (school of thought), from thousands of people, the Muslims (!) - not people who do not know the abrogating Hadith from the abrogated, nor do they know the concepts of the Arabic language in reality. For this imitation would be a blameworthy, unlucky imitation, because he who does this moves from day to night, from light to darkness, and from correctness to error. For the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, commanded us to take knowledge from scholars who are scholars in their morals, and scholars in their behavior. His hinting that they are exploited and rented for the (Wahhabi) tendency! And that they are pretenders to Ijtihad! And in the freedom of their thought, they are scholars, they are not exploited for a call or tendency, nor are they rented for a group or following. Rather, they are independent. If the Sultan courted them to say a saying that would be in his interest, they would reject the Sultan and his kingdom. They were trusted, and torture befell them while they were happy with that. I mention to you a man, not like Abu Hanifa and Al-Shafi'i but from their followers: Shams al-A'imma al-Sarakhsi, an Imam who was in the ninth century Hijri [Note: Sarakhsi was actually 5th century AH]. In his time there was a Sultan who monopolized rule, so Imam Al-Sarakhsi issued a fatwa against the Sultan, so the Sultan imprisoned him in a well for nearly twenty years. He imprisoned him in the well for nearly twenty years (sic, repeated) or more than that. So he authored while he was imprisoned in the well; his students would come to him there while he was in the well, and he would dictate to them a dictation, as I speak like this, without looking at a paper, or reading from a book, or holding a pen or ruler (!). Rather it was an overflow of knowledge Allah granted to that human. He dictated to them thirty-six volumes, rising from the ground the height of a full meter. He dictated them from his chest (memory). And this human, despite the breadth of his knowledge, did not depart from imitating those

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: Imams. Not following them out of weakness, but following them out of conviction, because they deserve to be emulated. For the Imams, the Salaf as-Salih (Pious Predecessors), did not care about the Sultan, nor did they care about a call from the calls (here are unintelligible words). Many died persecuted and torture befell them, like Abu Hanifa, may Allah be pleased with him - according to one saying - he died tortured in prison because he denied the Sultan (sic). As for Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal, may Allah be pleased with him, torture befell him in a way unimaginable. He was struck with whips that were not counted, so that he would say a word regarding the matter of the Holy Quran which the Sultan wanted to adopt and call the scholars to say, the Imams among them, like Ahmad bin Hanbal. So Ahmad bin Hanbal, may Allah be pleased with him, met varieties of torture, yet he did not depart from his opinion, nor did he sell his opinion for a few dirhams for a call the Sultan invited him to. So the blame of a blamer did not seize them in [the cause of] Allah. They used to say the saying clearly from their knowledge, conviction, and understanding. If they realized their error in this saying, they called out against it the next day or after years, that it was an error. And they returned from it, the return of a person from something not regretted. So this Imam Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, established a long, broad Madhhab (!), then he moved to Iraq [Note: Text says Iraq, historically Egypt], and toured some Islamic lands, and Sunan from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and Hadiths reached him which had not reached him (!) before. So he changed his entire Ijtihad (!), until it was as if he abrogated his old Madhhab, and established a new Madhhab. And he did not care that people said: Yesterday he was saying such, and today he changes his opinion. And one of the followers of Abu Hanifa, Hasan bin Ziyad, was in a position where people returned to him for Fatwa. So he issued a Fatwa, then it became clear to him that he erred in it. So he sent a crier calling out among the people and saying in the town: That (sic) Hasan bin Ziyad, a human asked him for a Fatwa

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: he does not know who he is? So he gave him a wrong Fatwa of such and such, and the correct [ruling] is such and such. Hasan bin Ziyad has erred. So they used to call out against themselves if they exceeded the Sharia, that they had erred. And Abu Hanifa, the Greatest Imam, may Allah be pleased with him and with all the Imams, has sayings in the Madhhab regarding which it is known that he returned from them. And Imam Ahmad bin Hanbal, may Allah be pleased with him, is the most frequent of people and Imams in returning from his sayings when he moves to new knowledge regarding them. That is because they are sincere to the religion; they do not belong to a group (!) nor do they worship for desire, greed, or fear. Rather, their goal is realizing the guidance of Allah the Mighty and Majestic, and clarifying the Law of Allah the Mighty and Majestic. So these Imams are the place of example for people, their present, their past, and their last, until Allah inherits the earth and whoever is on it, and He is the Best of Inheritors. His opinion on Ijtihad and the Pretenders to Ijtihad (Mutamajhidin), and in what thing Ijtihad should be. It is very joyful that people emerge among the people who have the aptitude for Ijtihad, and the tools of Ijtihad, so they perform Ijtihad among people today and tomorrow in the events and incidents that occur, and confuse scholars in extracting their rulings and clarifying their position regarding Allah's Halal and Haram. So if those people, the pretenders to Ijtihad (!), have a scope in Ijtihad, then they should not strive in faulting what has already been strived in (decided), and people have passed upon it (!). Rather, let them strive in what has occurred for people of rulings and actions for which scholars do not know the extraction of their rulings, and applying them to their place from what Allah permitted or forbade. Therefore, a person should not fall short a double shortcoming, attributing ignorance to the scholar, and speaking out of ignorance as well, for this is a great deficiency.

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: His accusing the Salafis of declaring the one who seeks means (Tawassul) by a grave owner a disbeliever, and that he is a polytheist whose blood is lawful! Among the deficiency that these people fall into is that if they find a human touching a grave, or seeking means (Tawassul) by a grave owner, they count him a polytheist (Mushrik), a disbeliever (Kafir), whose blood is lawful, who is not buried in Muslim cemeteries, nor prayed upon, nor inherited from, nor married, nor married from, nor married to. That is because in their belief he is a polytheist. His permitting Tawassul by the dead! This is great injustice and clear ignorance. We do not approve of this person in his seeking means by the grave, or his touching of the stone. Rather, we say to him: He is ignorant, mistaken, in error. But there is a difference between error, ignorance, and deviation, and judging a person with Kufr (disbelief) by which he deserves the shedding of blood and prohibition of being buried in Muslim cemeteries, and that he be buried as a carcass of dogs and killer animals is buried. There is a big difference between this and that. His hinting to people that Shirk is only Shirk of Rububiyyah (Lordship), his interpretation of the intentions of those seeking aid from the dead, and his declaration that Tawassul by the dead to Allah the Exalted is a permissible right! We do not sense from a mistaken person like this one whom we pictured that he believes that this Prophet or this Wali (Saint) loosens and binds, gives and withholds, lowers and raises, and disposes in the destinies of Allah the Mighty and Majestic (!!). Rather, this human believes that this one by whom he seeks means has a rank (sic) with Allah the Mighty and Majestic and a noble place (sic). So he requests from Allah by the dignity of this human upon Him and his precedence with Him, that He answer

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: his supplication. And there is nothing of Haram in that (!). Rather, this man erred so he asked this human, and requested from him a direct request. His right [duty] was to seek means through him to Allah the Mighty and Majestic, and request from Allah, Glory be to Him, independently. For Allah the Mighty and Majestic says: {Call upon Me; I will respond to you} [Ghafir: 60]. And He says, teaching us: {It is You we worship and You we ask for help} [Al-Fatihah: 5]. So there is a difference between the error of the mistaken and the ignorance of the ignorant, and our declaring him a disbeliever and counting him a polytheist, immoral, disbeliever who does not meet with the Ummah of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. There is a big difference between this and that. His hinting that denying seeking aid (Istighatha) from the dead is not certainty but conjecture! And another thing, if we find the ignorant ones whose condition we described erring, then upon us (here are some words we could not understand, and it appears to be a repetition of the previous explanation of the difference between counting him) a disbeliever, fuel for Hell, and clarifying to him that he erred in what you estimate and assume (!). Then, in that case, he can descend from his error to his correctness. But if you come to him threatening, thundering, and foaming, as if he deserved killing, but you pardoned him out of kindness and generosity (!). Regarding this, the poet says: If attaining guidance was through humiliation... I would see guidance as not inclining to guidance (!). His ignorance of the Sharia and Prophetic Hadith and mixing into it what is not of it. For Pharaoh who claimed divinity and said {I am your most high lord} (Speech is not continuous on the tape) in it is exaggeration in praise. So the man urinated, until when he finished his urination, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: him, said: Bring me a Dhanub of water, meaning a bucket of water. So they brought a bucket of water and he poured the bucket, and purified the place of urine, and the matter ended. So the man returned to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: O Allah have mercy on me and have mercy on Muhammad and do not have mercy on anyone with us. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: You have narrowed a vast thing, O brother of the Arabs, generalize, generalize (!). So he said what meant 'Were it not for you, they would have killed me' (!). And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, guided this human who urinated in the holiest spot of the houses of Allah the Mighty and Majestic, he guided him gently. And it came regarding Ka'b bin Ujrah (sic) one of the Companions, that he entered the mosque and greeted while people were in prayer. So he said while they were in prayer: Peace be upon you and the mercy of Allah and His blessings (!). So the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, began silencing him, like this, meaning clapping for him (!), like this, meaning do not speak. So he feared for himself, what had he done (!), as if he fell into destruction. Then he entered into prayer (!). When he finished his prayer, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, called him. So Ka'b bin Ujrah says: May my father and mother be sacrificed for him, meaning I ransom him with my father and mother, peace and blessings be upon him. By Allah, he did not scold me, nor rebuke me, nor chide me - meaning he was not harsh on me. But he said: Indeed, this prayer of ours, nothing of the speech of people is suitable in it. Meaning he guided him with kindness, softness, and definition, and informed him of his affair. And it came in the Hadith that Khallad bin Rafi', one of the Companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him - and he had entered Islam - entered the mosque and prayed. And the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, was witnessing his prayer. So he prayed, and prayed, but he did not perform the prayer well at all. So he came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. So the Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Pray, for you have not prayed. Meaning repeat the prayer. So he went and prayed, and his prayer the second time was like his prayer the first time, incomplete, not perfect. When he returned to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him,

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: he said to him: Pray, for you have not prayed. Then he returned and prayed a third time, and his third prayer was like his first and second prayer. So he returned to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said to him: Pray, for you have not prayed. He said: O Messenger of Allah! I do not know except this. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, taught him how to raise, how to prostrate, how to stand, and how to sit. And how to recite? So his prayer became like the prayer of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him (!). So he did not push him (?) nor chide him. And in this is a lesson for us in a matter people err in. His return to [the claim] that Shirk is only Shirk of Rububiyyah, and his declaration that Tawassul by the dead is correct and permissible! So if a human errs and holds the window of a Wali or a Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, we say to him: This window, this stone does not harm nor benefit, nor advance nor delay. And this is a servant from the servants of Allah whom Allah the Mighty and Majestic honored with Prophethood, and made for him a rank with Him. Do you believe that he is the one who gives to you and withholds from you?! Everyone you ask in this state says to you: No (!). But I believe there is dignity (karamah) in him that is not present in me - I am a possessor of sins and offenses, disobedience and crimes, and actions from which the face and forehead blacken. So I know from my condition what I do not know from people. So how about this human, the Prophet or the righteous one? Therefore, I seek means (Atawassalu) through him to Allah the Mighty and Majestic. Therefore we say to him: Do not request from this Wali or Prophet. As for your seeking means through him, it is correct (!). And do not make the request from him, but the request is from the Lord of Lords who does not deny His asker nor deny the one begging Him. So he (here are unintelligible words) in fierceness, severity, and harshness. Then to be mistaken in the origin of his method, then people compel him to it.

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: Repeating his attack on Salafis and accusing them of being agents and that one of them is paid money to say the crooked is straight! This is what the mind of a rational person does not accept. I know and accept that a human is mistaken and calls people to his error! If his error stems from his heart and core, his thought and mind, and he sees that this error is straight (!) by his abstract mind, and calls people to that so they say like his saying, then he is excused because he sees this line as straight in his view, but it is crooked in the view of people. But to be invited to a crooked line, and be bought and sold, and money is given, and spent for him so that he says the crooked is straight. This is what is not followed (!) nor imitated at any time (!) nor walked in its path at all. For error, inasmuch as it is error, occurs from the great Imams and the small people. But for a human to be a caller to error due to a material reason, by which he was bought (!), this is the embodied cubic error that is not forgiven. Therefore, O assembly of people, as the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: The religion of Allah is between the extremist and the negligent (!). We ask Allah to guide us to the path of truth by the truth, and to make us upon the guidance of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, in word and deed, behavior and action, and to make us among those who say the truth and follow the best of it. And make us among those who enjoin good and forbid evil, believe in Allah, and call to Allah the Mighty and Majestic upon insight and guidance. And Allah speaks the truth and He guides to the path. I say this saying and ask Allah for forgiveness for me and you. Abu Ghuddah's sermon ended to its letters as it came on the recorded tape preserved with me, and I transferred it by pen to its draft, then whitened it (finalized it) with my pen as well with all precision and impartiality. Muhammad Nasir al-Din al-Albani. Damascus 24 Ramadan al-Mubarak year 1394.

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: Perhaps in this sermon of Abu Ghuddah is the decisive proof that the man pretends to be what is not in him. For example, in it he permits the Tawassul which the owner of the 'Tangible Leadership' denied according to him, following the three Imams as preceded. So when I asked him about it among the seven questions, he did not answer that he agrees - because he knows that if he did, the people of his town would say about him: He became a Sabean and a Wahhabi! And if he declared permissibility in the country of his job as he declared it in his sermon in his town, it would become clear to everyone with two eyes that he... and perhaps he would be dismissed from his job! Third - His insistence on the accusation: Abu Ghuddah still insists on his accusation of the Salafis with what I attributed to him previously in the Introduction (p. 44) from his saying in some of his sermons in Aleppo: "These Wahhabis, their souls are disgusted or shrink when the name of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, is mentioned." It is clear to him that by 'Wahhabis' - while he is preaching in Aleppo - he only means the Salafis in Aleppo and other places than the Saudi lands who disturbed his sleep by their calling people to the Book and the Sunnah, and fighting Shirk and innovation. So Abu Ghuddah stood defaming them and vilifying them with such slander and fabrication, which if it were true in anyone, God forbid, would be apostasy from the religion, and refuge is sought with Allah. Yet, Abu Ghuddah, may Allah treat him as he deserves, persisted on this false accusation, with some cunning and spinning and much malice and ill intent. He quoted in his 'Words' (p. 7) what was previously attributed to him from the source I had quoted from, with an addition of two lines I had turned away from for brevity. Then he quoted them with the mentioned line for Abu Ghuddah himself to reply to, so he was in that like 'the one searching for his death with his hoof'. They are:

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: "For (Abu Ghuddah) preached once in one of the mosques of Aleppo, and touched upon speaking about the Salafis, naming them (Wahhabis) imitating the common people and the rabble. And among what he said was: Indeed these Wahhabis, their souls are disgusted... (etc what I mentioned) which the most lying of people would not dare to say..." Abu Ghuddah said: Their words ended (1). Abu Ghuddah himself quoted this to reply to it, so he said directly following it: "Fall of the slander: And I say whoever's soul is disgusted by the mention of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him, is outside the religion (Millah) with certainty. And whoever said this in these days about the people of these Holy Lands, which hundreds of thousands of pilgrims of the Islamic world enter every year, has judged himself with absolute insanity and rejection by everyone who heard him... And there remains no possibility for anyone among people to believe such lies... So glory be to Allah, these people (meaning the Salafis) lie a mad lie and think that people have no minds, nor do they have eyes, nor do they have scales, and that they believe him in whatever they babble and slander! And it is known that the Prayer on the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, is a pillar of the pillars of prayer according to the master Hanbalis...". Convicting Abu Ghuddah of declaring the Salafis disbelievers (Takfir). Indeed, this reply of Abu Ghuddah to that paragraph attributed to him contains important matters: First: His admission of it issuing from him, and we take that, first:

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: From his lack of initiative to deny that and invalidate its attribution to him as is his habit in such cases, and the reader finds in his "Words" numerous examples of that. And secondly from his saying: "And whoever said this in these days about the people of these Holy Lands..." For the concept (Mafhum) of his saying "in these days" - and the concepts of Sheikhs are considered as the Hanafis say - is that whoever said that before these days is not among those whom Abu Ghuddah judged with absolute insanity. As if Abu Ghuddah wants to say: I have actually said that before I became aware of the truth by my mixing with the Najdis in their lands. As for after that, the falsehood of the disgust attributed to them became clear to me. So if this is what he intends, why did he not have some moral courage with that and declare that he was deceived by the tendentious propaganda that many of his innovator Sheikhs used to broadcast in the lands east and west, like Al-Kawthari and his likes, and before him Zayni Dahlan and his counterparts, until the Islamic lands were filled, specifically Syria, with this false accusation. Is it not obligatory upon him and his likes who knew the truth later, to announce it to all people, not letting the blame of a blamer seize them in [the cause of] Allah? Second: That he declares that attributing that disgust to the people of these Holy Lands is a lie and insanity according to his saying. So we ask him: Who are the people of the Holy Lands he means? If he means the people of the Najdi lands whose capital is Riyadh, then from where in the Sharia does he get that they are holy lands? Especially since the era with his likes is that they attack it and its people, evidenced by the fact that the majority of them still interpret his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, when he said: O Allah bless our Sham, O Allah bless our Yemen. They said: And our Najd, O Messenger of Allah?

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: He said: There are earthquakes and tribulations, and there the horn of Satan emerges. So they interpret their saying: "And in our Najd" to be the Najd known today, and interpret his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, there are earthquakes... as being a reference to Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul Wahhab and his call and followers! Although it came in a narration that they said: "And in our Iraq", so it explains the first narration, and upon that the commentators of Hadith like Al-Khattabi and Al-Asqalani and others proceeded. Yet, many Sheikhs in our country and others still obstinately uphold and carry the Hadith contrary to what the other narration conveyed, all of that to attack the Najdis and their pure call to Tawhid and fighting polytheism and idolatry! Rather, to attack everyone who called with this blessed call even if he was from other than those "Holy Lands"! Like the Salafis in Syria for example!! And if he means by his saying "people of the Holy Lands" the people of Mecca and Medina who are the general population and did not respond to the call of Muhammad bin Abdul Wahhab, and remained on their belief in polytheistic and idolatrous practices and grave worship, then Sheikh Abu Ghuddah would have deceived the readers especially and the Najdis generally with another malicious deception. That is because the people of Mecca and Medina, their lands are indeed holy, and it absolutely does not come to the minds of any of the readers other than that. And what supports it is his saying describing it "which hundreds of thousands of pilgrims of the Islamic world enter every year". In that case, they are not the ones he meant by his saying when he was in his old misguidance: "Indeed these Wahhabis, their souls are disgusted or shrink when they hear the mention of (the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, because there is no one who accuses the inhabitants of these holy lands actually of Wahhabism so that Abu Ghuddah clears them of this accusation. Rather, those accused of it are the Najdis ruling in it. So why did Abu Ghuddah turn away from declaring the clearance of these Najdis

book_title: Unveiling the Falsehoods and Fabrications in Abu Ghuddah's 'Words'
text: from this accusation which he used to affix to them while he was in Aleppo before he became one of the inhabitants of those "Holy Lands"?! The answer is that such a declaration, if he revealed it, two matters would bind him, one of which is inevitable: 1 - Convicting him of lying and fabricating against innocent people, and Allah the Mighty and Majestic says: {And whoever earns a fault or a sin and then blames it on an innocent [person] has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin} [An-Nisa: 112]. So how about if he throws it at a group, or rather an entire people, and when he inhabited their land he began to praise them and curry favor with them by commending them in his "Words" (p. 13 and 14)! 2 - His dismissal from his job, for the sake of retaining which he shows people that he is a Salafi professing the Tawhid called to by Ibn Taymiyyah and Ibn Abdul Wahhab!! Third: * Suppose that Abu Ghuddah meant by his previous saying to clear the Najdis themselves from his accusing them previously, and that he did not mean by the Holy Lands their Najdi lands, but rather meant the two Noble Sanctuaries indeed, and attributed it to them on the basis that they are the rulers over them. Then in that case, it is an evasion and a malicious plot from him. Because the accusation attributed to him is not regarding the rulers of these Holy Lands directly, but rather it is regarding the group of Tawhid living in Aleppo and other Syrian lands, who are known there as "Salafis". These are the ones regarding whom it was claimed against Abu Ghuddah that he accused them of that false accusation. So if we see him fleeing from clearing them of it, to clearing those against whom accusing them of it was not claimed - even if he and others of the innovators include them in their accusation of those charges along with the Salafis and others of the people of Tawhid - then this means two things:
